home.title: Welcome
home.intro: Hello! My name is Arthur GELINEAU, I‚Äôm 19 years old and currently studying at ENSEEIHT (INP Toulouse) in the Digital Sciences department. I‚Äôm passionate about cybersecurity, and I‚Äôm particularly interested in its technical aspects, such as penetration testing, Red Teaming, and bug bounty, and its strategic and entrepreneurial dimensions.
home.p1: Through this ePortfolio, I aim to share my academic journey, technical projects, and reflections on cybersecurity as a constantly evolving field. It reflects both my learning path at ENSEEIHT and self-taught learner in cybersecurity, my curiosity for technology, and my motivation to tackle real-world security challenges.
home.p2: I‚Äôm especially drawn to offensive security and to exploring how cybersecurity applies to defense and critical systems, where reliability and resilience are paramount.
home.p3: Feel free to browse through the different sections to learn more about my studies, technical work, and ambitions in the fascinating world of cybersecurity.

engineering.title: Engineering Courses & Projects
engineering.content: This section presents my main academic achievements and projects completed during my engineering studies. It highlights both theoretical and practical experiences that helped me develop technical skills, teamwork abilities, and problem-solving strategies.

mobility.title: International Mobility
mobility.intro: This section focuses on my international experience and cultural openness as an engineering student. Whether through an exchange program, internship abroad, or a future mobility plan, I aim to broaden my perspective, improve my language skills, and discover new approaches to engineering around the world.
mobility.content: I am planning an international mobility and have highlighted the countries I am interested in on the world map. Click on each country to discover my motivations and what I aim to learn there.

countries.name: The United States of America
countries.reason: The United States is a global leader in cybersecurity research and technological innovation. A mobility there would let me immerse myself in academic and industry environments focused on offensive security, while also improving my English skills and understanding of international cybersecurity practices.

countries.name: Brazil
countries.reason: Brazil has a dynamic tech ecosystem and a rich culture to explore. A mobility there would allow me to engage with local universities and companies, experience innovative approaches to cybersecurity, and improve my Portuguese skills in a professional and academic context.

countries.name: Mexico
countries.reason: Mexico offers interesting universities and opportunities to work on regional cybersecurity challenges. A mobility there would enable me to participate in local academic projects, gain insights into Latin American cybersecurity practices, and improve my Spanish skills in a practical environment.

civic.title: Civic Engagement & Sustainability
civic.intro: Here I share my involvement in social, civic, or environmental activities that contribute to building a responsible and sustainable society. These experiences have helped me develop a sense of social responsibility, teamwork, and awareness of global issues beyond technical challenges.
civic.content: Throughout my academic journey, I have taken part in various initiatives that allowed me to develop a sense of responsibility and teamwork. In Toulouse, I participated in a clean walk organized by the Bureau of Sustainable Development, contributing to local environmental awareness. I also briefly engaged in a project during my engineering studies aimed at detecting plastic bottles in oceans. Beyond environmental initiatives, I am actively involved in school life: I serve as a mentor and intervenant for my school‚Äôs Junior Enterprise and regularly participate in events organized by the Net7 IT club. Previously, during my preparatory classes, I was a member of the Student Council, an experience that helped me build organizational and leadership skills. These activities have taught me how to collaborate effectively, manage responsibilities, and apply my skills in diverse contexts.

activities.title: Sports & Activities
activities.intro: Beyond academics, I believe in the importance of balance and personal development through sports and hobbies. Here I share the activities that inspire me, help me stay motivated, and allow me to cultivate teamwork, perseverance, and creativity.

cards.title: Rugby & Basketball
cards.description: I practiced these sports for several years, which taught me the value of teamwork, communication, and collaboration.

cards.title: Music
cards.description: In parallel, I studied music for 12 years, an experience that strengthened my creativity, listening skills, and attention to detail.

cards.title: Tennis & Weight Training
cards.description: Sports are an essential part of my daily routine. I practice these activities almost every day to develop discipline, perseverance, and long-term commitment.

cards.title: Cooking
cards.description: I really enjoy cooking, whether it‚Äôs experimenting with new flavors or sharing a pleasant moment with friends. Cooking allows me to develop creativity, precision, and the ability to follow structured processes while staying flexible and inventive, qualities that I also apply to the way I approach my technical projects.

activities.conclusion: These different activities, both athletic and artistic, help me maintain a healthy balance between personal challenge, teamwork, and self-expression, qualities that I aim to bring into my engineering and cybersecurity projects.

career.title: Career Development
career.content: This section summarizes my professional profile, including my CV, career goals, and personal projects that shape my future as an engineer. You will also find links to my LinkedIn profile, resume, and a brief video presentation describing my ambitions and professional values.
